content.title: Education Loan Scheme under NSKFDC- Haryana
content.department: Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC)
content.details: The scheme 'Education Loan Scheme under NSKFDC' is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC). This scheme offers educational loans of up to ₹10 lakhs for studies within India and up to ₹20 lakhs for studies abroad. These loans are available to eligible students pursuing regular full-time recognized professional/technical courses in India or abroad.
benefits: Maximum Loan Limit for studies within India: Up to ₹10,00,000/-
Maximum Loan Limit for studies abroad: Up to ₹20,00,000/-

Loan covers admission fees, tuition fees, books, stationery, examination fees, boarding and lodging expenses, insurance premium, travel expenses for studying abroad, caution money, and development funds.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant's age should be between 18 and 55 years.
The applicant should be Safai Karamchari or his/her dependent.
The loan shall be provided to students for pursuing regular full-time recognized professional/technical courses in India or abroad.
The Education loan for a particular student shall be made admissible only once either at Diploma/Graduation or Post Graduation Diploma/Post Graduation level.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Applicants can apply through the official website of HSFDC or the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: A certificate from the Indian embassy Consulate on confirmation of admission given to the applicant
Accreditation status of the Course for which loan is to be availed in case of abroad study
Accreditation status of the Educational institution for which the loan is to be availed
Approval or Clearance Certificate from Competent Authority if Required only above Loan Cases of ₹1,00,000/-
Copy of admission confirmation from an educational institute with fee and other charges payment schedule yearly
Copy of Foreign exchange permit if applicable
Copy of Identity card issued by the Institute if admission has already taken
Copy of passport or visa number etc. if studying abroad
Copy of school leaving certificate in support of date of birth
Copy of the prospectus of the course for which the loan is sought
Loan Application form duly filled up or SC Certificate
Residence Certificate issued by competent authority
Safai karamchari or Dependent of Safai karamchari Certificate issued by the competent authority

faqs.question: Who can avail of this educational loan?
faqs.answer: The loan is available to Safai Karamcharis or their dependents who are permanent residents of Haryana and are pursuing full-time recognized professional or technical courses in India or abroad.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount available for studies within India?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount for studies within India is ₹10,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount available for studies abroad?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount for studies abroad is ₹20,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What expenses are covered under this education loan?
faqs.answer: The loan covers admission fees, tuition fees, books, stationery, examination fees, boarding and lodging expenses, insurance premium, travel expenses for studying abroad, caution money, and development funds.

faqs.question: Are there any age limits for applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants should be between 18 and 55 years old.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for applicants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for applicants.

faqs.question: How is the loan amount disbursed?
faqs.answer: The loan amount is disbursed through the state channelizing agencies to the concerned government-recognized educational institutions.

faqs.question: When does the repayment of the loan start?
faqs.answer: Repayment starts 6 months after the completion of the course or upon gaining employment, whichever is earlier.

faqs.question: How long is the repayment period?
faqs.answer: The loan is to be repaid in 20 quarterly installments over 5 years from the date of the first disbursement.

faqs.question: What is meant by a permanent Safai Karamchari?
faqs.answer: A permanent Safai Karamchari is a person engaged in sanitation work, including their dependents.

faqs.question: How to apply for the educational loan?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the official website of HSFDC or the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: What is the tag/maker on the diploma/degree of the student?
faqs.answer: The tag/maker indicates the student’s repayment liabilities for the loan taken.

faqs.question: Can the loan be availed for part-time courses?
faqs.answer: No, the loan is only for regular full-time recognized professional/technical courses.
